alert.note: Alert for Lancaster (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 12:59PM EST until December 19 at 2:21AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Conestoga River At Lancaster affecting Lancaster County. For the Conestoga River...including Lancaster...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Conestoga River at Lancaster. * WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Grofftown Road will flood. At 13.0 feet, Several homes are affected by high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 11.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:30 PM EST Monday was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued The next statement will be issued late tonight.
